values.description:
Implement the `GAZEBODISTRO_BRANCH`paremeter in Jenkins for builds using vctools \(currently colcon builds\) to pass custom branches to it so it can built different source branches.

Tested:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_rendering-pr-win&build=124)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/124/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/124/))
values.title: Support for custom branches in gazebodistro for colcon builds

summary.raw:
Implement the `GAZEBODISTRO_BRANCH`paremeter in Jenkins for builds using vctools \(currently colcon builds\) to pass custom branches to it so it can built different source branches.

Tested:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_rendering-pr-win&build=124)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/124/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/124/))
summary.html:

Tested:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/124/)

values.description:
DO NOT MERGE.

This is an attempt to fix Windows build for Gazebo 9 \(x64\). In this change, I am proposing to upgrade the toolchain to msvc2017, do dependencies refresh for msvc2017, and fix the build breaks first. Can we do a refresh on [http://packages.osrfoundation.org/win32/deps/](http://packages.osrfoundation.org/win32/deps/)?

* FreeImage3180Win32Win64.zip:

    * Binary SDK: [http://freeimage.sourceforge.net/download.html](http://freeimage.sourceforge.net/download.html)
    
* boost\_1\_67\_0.zip:

    * Binary SDK: [https://sourceforge.net/projects/boost/files/boost-binaries/1.67.0/boost\_1\_67\_0-msvc-14.1-64.exe/download](https://sourceforge.net/projects/boost/files/boost-binaries/1.67.0/boost_1_67_0-msvc-14.1-64.exe/download)
    
* qt-opensource-windows-x86-msvc2015\_64-5.7.0.zip

    * Binary SDK: [https://download.qt.io/archive/qt/5.7/5.7.0/qt-opensource-windows-x86-msvc2015\_64-5.7.0.exe.mirrorlist](https://download.qt.io/archive/qt/5.7/5.7.0/qt-opensource-windows-x86-msvc2015_64-5.7.0.exe.mirrorlist)
    
* ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip

    * Binary SDK: [https://bintray.com/ogrecave/ogre/download\_file?file\_path=ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip](https://bintray.com/ogrecave/ogre/download_file?file_path=ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip)
    

And here is the corresponding change to demonstrate it built with Gazebo repo:  
[https://bitbucket.org/seanyen-msft/gazebo/branches/compare/seanyen-msft/gazebo:gazebo9\_9.5.0\_stagingosrf/gazebo:gazebo9\_9.5.0#diff](https://bitbucket.org/seanyen-msft/gazebo/branches/compare/seanyen-msft/gazebo:gazebo9_9.5.0_staging%0Dosrf/gazebo:gazebo9_9.5.0#diff)

And here is a success run under Azure DevOps \(Check the “OSRF Job” where I mimic what Jenkins does\):  
[https://ros-win.visualstudio.com/ros-win/\_build/results?buildId=2256](https://ros-win.visualstudio.com/ros-win/_build/results?buildId=2256)
values.title: Upgrade Windows dependencies for Gazebo and build support

DO NOT MERGE.

This is an attempt to fix Windows build for Gazebo 9 (x64). In this change, I am proposing to upgrade the toolchain to msvc2017, do dependencies refresh for msvc2017, and fix the build breaks first. Can we do a refresh on http://packages.osrfoundation.org/win32/deps/?

  • FreeImage3180Win32Win64.zip:

    • Binary SDK: http://freeimage.sourceforge.net/download.html

  • boost_1_67_0.zip:

    • Binary SDK: https://sourceforge.net/projects/boost/files/boost-binaries/1.67.0/boost_1_67_0-msvc-14.1-64.exe/download

  • qt-opensource-windows-x86-msvc2015_64-5.7.0.zip

    • Binary SDK: https://download.qt.io/archive/qt/5.7/5.7.0/qt-opensource-windows-x86-msvc2015_64-5.7.0.exe.mirrorlist

  • ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip

    • Binary SDK: https://bintray.com/ogrecave/ogre/download_file?file_path=ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip

And here is the corresponding change to demonstrate it built with Gazebo repo:
https://bitbucket.org/seanyen-msft/gazebo/branches/compare/seanyen-msft/gazebo:gazebo9_9.5.0_stagingosrf/gazebo:gazebo9_9.5.0#diff

values.description: The release script throws an error if the \`debian\` directory is missing, e.g. the [ign-cmake2-release](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake2-release/) repo does not have this directory. I had to make the following changes in order release the ign-cmake2 prerelease debs
values.title: Check for presence of debian directory on release

values.description:
Just a suggestion, I'm not sure if there was a reason to be using `console_cohesion`.

I noticed that [this build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/152/consoleFull) was hanging and not giving much information about what was going on besides `[Processing: ignition-physics1]`. With a direct output, maybe we can understand better where the build is hanging.

As a reference, [ROS 2 CI builds](https://ci.ros2.org/job/ci_linux/5940/parameters/) use `console_direct` by default.
values.title: Use console_direct instead of console_cohesion

summary.raw:
Just a suggestion, I'm not sure if there was a reason to be using `console_cohesion`.

I noticed that [this build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/152/consoleFull) was hanging and not giving much information about what was going on besides `[Processing: ignition-physics1]`. With a direct output, maybe we can understand better where the build is hanging.

As a reference, [ROS 2 CI builds](https://ci.ros2.org/job/ci_linux/5940/parameters/) use `console_direct` by default.
summary.html:
Just a suggestion, I'm not sure if there was a reason to be using console_cohesion.

I noticed that this build was hanging and not giving much information about what was going on besides [Processing: ignition-physics1]. With a direct output, maybe we can understand better where the build is hanging.

As a reference, ROS 2 CI builds use console_direct by default.

values.description:
As of [Homebrew/brew#5467](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/5467), the functionality of `brew prune` will be included in `brew cleanup`, which is already run on line 43 of this file, so we don't need to try to call it again here.

Also, we can remove the 10.14 `brew doctor` logic since it has been released for a few months now.

This is ready for review now that brew 1.9.0 is released.

* https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/releases/tag/1.9.0
values.title: Don't need to call brew prune any more

summary.raw:
As of [Homebrew/brew#5467](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/5467), the functionality of `brew prune` will be included in `brew cleanup`, which is already run on line 43 of this file, so we don't need to try to call it again here.

Also, we can remove the 10.14 `brew doctor` logic since it has been released for a few months now.

This is ready for review now that brew 1.9.0 is released.

* https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/releases/tag/1.9.0
summary.html:
As of Homebrew/brew#5467, the functionality of brew prune will be included in brew cleanup, which is already run on line 43 of this file, so we don't need to try to call it again here.

Also, we can remove the 10.14 brew doctor logic since it has been released for a few months now.

This is ready for review now that brew 1.9.0 is released.

  • https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/releases/tag/1.9.0

values.description:
To support the gz11 deb generation here is the first set of changes:

* support for `--extra-osrf-repo` in release.py \(to use prerelease \+ stable \+ nightly\)
* support for `--nightly-src-branch` in release.py \(to indicate the branch to build the nightlies from\)

The logic to select the proper params lives at this moment at [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gz11-nightly-scheduler/configure](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gz11-nightly-scheduler/configure) . I still need to migrate it to DSL but the thing seems to be working at the moment:

* sdformat8 

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat8-debbuilder&build=49)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat8-debbuilder/49/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat8-debbuilder/49/))


* ign-common3
* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-common3-debbuilder&build=23)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common3-debbuilder/23/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common3-debbuilder/23/))
values.title: Support gz11 nightly deb generation

summary.raw:
To support the gz11 deb generation here is the first set of changes:

* support for `--extra-osrf-repo` in release.py \(to use prerelease \+ stable \+ nightly\)
* support for `--nightly-src-branch` in release.py \(to indicate the branch to build the nightlies from\)

The logic to select the proper params lives at this moment at [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gz11-nightly-scheduler/configure](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gz11-nightly-scheduler/configure) . I still need to migrate it to DSL but the thing seems to be working at the moment:

* sdformat8 

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat8-debbuilder&build=49)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat8-debbuilder/49/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat8-debbuilder/49/))


* ign-common3
* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-common3-debbuilder&build=23)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common3-debbuilder/23/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common3-debbuilder/23/))
summary.html:
To support the gz11 deb generation here is the first set of changes:

  • support for --extra-osrf-repo in release.py (to use prerelease + stable + nightly)
  • support for --nightly-src-branch in release.py (to indicate the branch to build the nightlies from)

The logic to select the proper params lives at this moment at https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gz11-nightly-scheduler/configure . I still need to migrate it to DSL but the thing seems to be working at the moment:

  • sdformat8

    https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat8-debbuilder/49/)

  • ign-common3

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common3-debbuilder/23/)

values.title: Use nightlies on CI

values.description:
To help with debian library transitions \(when a change in a library ABI/API needs rebuild of debian official packages\) I added support to run the tool ratt. I tested it with the simbody library 3.6.1 is landing in Debian unstable:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=debian-ratt-builder&build=19)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/debian-ratt-builder/19/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/debian-ratt-builder/19/))
values.title: Add debian ratt (rebuild all the things) custom job for testing library transitions

summary.raw:
To help with debian library transitions \(when a change in a library ABI/API needs rebuild of debian official packages\) I added support to run the tool ratt. I tested it with the simbody library 3.6.1 is landing in Debian unstable:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=debian-ratt-builder&build=19)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/debian-ratt-builder/19/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/debian-ratt-builder/19/))
summary.html:
To help with debian library transitions (when a change in a library ABI/API needs rebuild of debian official packages) I added support to run the tool ratt. I tested it with the simbody library 3.6.1 is landing in Debian unstable:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/debian-ratt-builder/19/)

values.description:
Continuation of work done by @seanyen-msft in [the previous PR](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/704/upgrade-windows-dependencies-for-gazebo/diff). Most of the details are in the first PR, here is a summary:

* target gazebo9 branch 
* update to msvc2017
* refresh some dependencies: FreeImage, boost, qt and ogre.
* change dependencies location to use always [http://gazebosim.org/distributions/](http://gazebosim.org/distributions/)
* split the script for gazebo8 to keep the this version working with previous commands.

Tested for gazebo9 branch:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=2430)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/2430/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2430/))

Tested for gazebo8 branch:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64&build=195)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os\_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64/195/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64/195/))
values.title: Upgrade Windows dependencies for Gazebo and build support (take II)

summary.raw:
Continuation of work done by @seanyen-msft in [the previous PR](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/704/upgrade-windows-dependencies-for-gazebo/diff). Most of the details are in the first PR, here is a summary:

* target gazebo9 branch 
* update to msvc2017
* refresh some dependencies: FreeImage, boost, qt and ogre.
* change dependencies location to use always [http://gazebosim.org/distributions/](http://gazebosim.org/distributions/)
* split the script for gazebo8 to keep the this version working with previous commands.

Tested for gazebo9 branch:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=2430)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/2430/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2430/))

Tested for gazebo8 branch:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64&build=195)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os\_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64/195/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64/195/))
summary.html:
Continuation of work done by @seanyen-msft in the previous PR. Most of the details are in the first PR, here is a summary:

  • target gazebo9 branch
  • update to msvc2017
  • refresh some dependencies: FreeImage, boost, qt and ogre.
  • change dependencies location to use always http://gazebosim.org/distributions/
  • split the script for gazebo8 to keep the this version working with previous commands.

Tested for gazebo9 branch:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2430/)

Tested for gazebo8 branch:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64/195/)

values.description:
When making the gazebo10 prerelease just now, I had an issue with release.py not supporting double-digit major version numbers that is fixed by this PR:

~~~
Running:
  make package_source

 !! Can not find a tarball at: /tmp/tmptb6f__/build/gazebo1-10.0.0~pre1.tar.bz2 or at /tmp/tmptb6f__/build/gazebo1-10.0.0~pre1.tar.bz2

~~~
values.title: support double-digit major version numbers when stripping the major version from the tarball name

values.description:
The following jobs use linuxbrew to create homebrew pull requests and update the bottle hashes.

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/

Recently, the speed of these jobs has been greatly reduced. The jobs should be very quick, but creating a pull request has changed from [4 minutes a few months ago](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/319/) to [30 minutes today](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/344/) and updating bottle hashes from [5 minutes](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/602/) to [30 minutes](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/626/).

Something has changed upstream at linuxbrew, and I believe they are requiring more packages to be installed by default, and while bottles (precompiled binaries) are available, they require brew to be installed in a specific location. This pull request updates our homebrew setup script to use the linuxbrew installer with the default location. Also, it doesn't reinstall linuxbrew every time, so it should be a bit faster.

With this pull request, the job times are now [under a minute](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/630/).
values.title: Speed up jobs using linuxbrew

summary.raw:
The following jobs use linuxbrew to create homebrew pull requests and update the bottle hashes.

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/

Recently, the speed of these jobs has been greatly reduced. The jobs should be very quick, but creating a pull request has changed from [4 minutes a few months ago](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/319/) to [30 minutes today](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/344/) and updating bottle hashes from [5 minutes](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/602/) to [30 minutes](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/626/).

Something has changed upstream at linuxbrew, and I believe they are requiring more packages to be installed by default, and while bottles (precompiled binaries) are available, they require brew to be installed in a specific location. This pull request updates our homebrew setup script to use the linuxbrew installer with the default location. Also, it doesn't reinstall linuxbrew every time, so it should be a bit faster.

With this pull request, the job times are now [under a minute](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/630/).
summary.html:
The following jobs use linuxbrew to create homebrew pull requests and update the bottle hashes.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/

Recently, the speed of these jobs has been greatly reduced. The jobs should be very quick, but creating a pull request has changed from 4 minutes a few months ago to 30 minutes today and updating bottle hashes from 5 minutes to 30 minutes.

Something has changed upstream at linuxbrew, and I believe they are requiring more packages to be installed by default, and while bottles (precompiled binaries) are available, they require brew to be installed in a specific location. This pull request updates our homebrew setup script to use the linuxbrew installer with the default location. Also, it doesn't reinstall linuxbrew every time, so it should be a bit faster.

With this pull request, the job times are now under a minute.

values.title: ignition.dsl: add cmake[12], math[56] to stable branches, remove gz11

summary.html:
We have recently made stable releases of the following:

  • ign-cmake1
  • ign-cmake2
  • ign-math5
  • ign-math6

So treat them like stable branches, and remove cmake and math from gz11 branch testing.

Tested here:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_ignition/725/

values.title: Do not use ROS repos when building gazebo and sdformat debs

values.description:
Some builds have started to fail since the 2019-02-01 time limit on release repositories expired:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=36)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64/36/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64/36/

This pushes back the deadline to 2019-03-01 for anything that requires more than cmake2 and math6, which already have stable releases.
values.title: keep using prerelease repositories in CI until 2019-03-01 for things that require more than cmake2 / math6

summary.raw:
Some builds have started to fail since the 2019-02-01 time limit on release repositories expired:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=36)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64/36/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64/36/

This pushes back the deadline to 2019-03-01 for anything that requires more than cmake2 and math6, which already have stable releases.
summary.html:
Some builds have started to fail since the 2019-02-01 time limit on release repositories expired:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64/36/

This pushes back the deadline to 2019-03-01 for anything that requires more than cmake2 and math6, which already have stable releases.

values.description:
The gazebo9 tests don't compile on windows, so that has been disabled from CI, but we should try fixing that now that we have some external contributors who are helping with windows support.

Currently the `UNIT_Time_TEST` fails to compile:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64&build=85)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/85/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/85/

cc @seanyen-msft 

We shouldn't merge this until gazebo 9, 10, and default compile with this branch.

values.description:
We have an incoming PR targeted at `ros2` which will break compatibility with Crystal. I created a `crystal` branch and the `ros2` branch will keep receiving updates for Dashing.

So I need:

* `ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-*_crystal-bionic-amd64` to be triggered for `crystal` instead of `ros2`
* New `ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-*_dashing-bionic-amd64` for the `ros2` branch (it could also be something else instead of dashing, like `devel`?

@\_jrivero\_, do you think this PR covers that? I don't want to run it and break everything :grin:
values.title: Use crystal branch for ROS2

summary.raw:

So I need:

* New `ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-*_dashing-bionic-amd64` for the `ros2` branch (it could also be something else instead of dashing, like `devel`?

@\_jrivero\_, do you think this PR covers that? I don't want to run it and break everything :grin:
summary.html:
We have an incoming PR targeted at ros2 which will break compatibility with Crystal. I created a crystal branch and the ros2 branch will keep receiving updates for Dashing.

So I need:

  • ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-*_crystal-bionic-amd64 to be triggered for crystal instead of ros2
  • New ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-*_dashing-bionic-amd64 for the ros2 branch (it could also be something else instead of dashing, like devel?

@_jrivero_, do you think this PR covers that? I don't want to run it and break everything

values.description:
This is in support of the following pull request that updates ign-tools to ign-cmake2:

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/6/updating-to-use-ignition-cmake-2/diff

it does the following: 

* ign_tools-compilation.bash: depend on libignition-cmake2-dev

* disable ign-tools default xenial job

* ign-tools doesn't need GPU for CI
values.title: ign-tools: depend on cmake2, disable xenial job

summary.raw:
This is in support of the following pull request that updates ign-tools to ign-cmake2:

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/6/updating-to-use-ignition-cmake-2/diff

it does the following: 

* ign_tools-compilation.bash: depend on libignition-cmake2-dev

* disable ign-tools default xenial job

* ign-tools doesn't need GPU for CI
summary.html:
This is in support of the following pull request that updates ign-tools to ign-cmake2:

  • https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/6/updating-to-use-ignition-cmake-2/diff

it does the following:

  • ign_tools-compilation.bash: depend on libignition-cmake2-dev

  • disable ign-tools default xenial job

  • ign-tools doesn't need GPU for CI

values.description:
The Ubuntu support is in place \(compiling ign-tools from a PR\) but the upstream code still needs to be fixed:

* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_plugins-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_plugins-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/1/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_plugins-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1/))



The Windows support is in place \(together with the[ gazebodistro PR](#!/osrf/gazebodistro/pull-requests/18/add-formula-for-ign-plugins/diff)\). It needs to compile the whole ignition family.

* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_plugins-pr-win/3//badge/icon)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_plugins-pr-win/3/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_plugins-pr-win/3/))



I’ve created the Mac formula but I think we can not test it until ign-tools PR has been merged. 

[https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/commit/6f6061c5ab61ccac2945cc42c290751a0b366933](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/commit/6f6061c5ab61ccac2945cc42c290751a0b366933)
values.title: Support for ignition-plugins CI

summary.html:
The Ubuntu support is in place (compiling ign-tools from a PR) but the upstream code still needs to be fixed:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_plugins-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1/)

The Windows support is in place (together with the gazebodistro PR). It needs to compile the whole ignition family.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_plugins-pr-win/3/)

I’ve created the Mac formula but I think we can not test it until ign-tools PR has been merged.

values.reason: using a different name for the software family

values.description:
**Linux:**  auto selection of Ubuntu is not working since it lacks [bitbucket-pipelines file](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch/pull-requests/7) \(in PR\)

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_launch-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_launch-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_launch-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64))

**Windows:** there is a bug in Windows build of the ign-tools branch:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_launch-pr-win&build=3)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_launch-pr-win/3](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_launch-pr-win/3/))

**Mac:**  [work in progress](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/595) but probably need to wait until the open PRs are merged.
values.title: Support for ign-launch
